title: Welcome

Welcome
Welcome to my academic website. I am a mathematical biologist specializing in infectious disease modeling and population dynamics in ecological systems. My work integrates deterministic and stochastic modeling, climate data, and public health strategies.

title: "Research"
---

My research focuses on mathematical models of mosquito population dynamics in response to environmental conditions such as temperature, rainfall, and photoperiod. I use deterministic and stochastic modeling approaches to simulate mosquito life stages, including diapause behavior.

I analyze the implications of seasonal climate change on Culex mosquito abundance and the potential for disease transmission, and apply sensitivity analysis to evaluate the robustness of model outcomes.

title: "About Me"
---

I am currently a PhD candidate in Mathematical Biology at Memorial University of Newfoundland. My research focuses on climate-driven models of mosquito population dynamics, using temperature, rainfall, and photoperiod data to inform vector control and public health strategies.

I have experience teaching undergraduate mathematics and programming in R, and enjoy mentoring students in research, data analysis, and scientific communication.
